title: Donald Trump's miraculous political survival
summary: On the edge of a precipice after the January 6 assault on the Capitol launched by his supporters and two impeachment proceedings, Trump has managed to regain control of the Grand Old Party.

title: Spain flood death toll soars to at least 158
summary: An exceptionally powerful Mediterranean storm from Tuesday unleashed heavy rains and torrents of mud-filled water that swept away people and wrecked homes.

title: US says up to 8,000 North Korean troops ready for Ukraine combat as missile launch raises tensions
summary: Citing US intelligence, Secretary of State Antony Blinken said that some 8,000 of the 10,000 North Korean troops believed to be in Russia have made their way to the Kursk border region.

title: For Macron's visit to Morocco, some surprising guests were among plethoric delegation
summary: Three months after the publication of a report by France's audit court calling for further efforts to reduce the 'size of delegations' on state trips, the French president flew to Rabat with over 130 people, including close friends and family.

title: Carlos Alcaraz knocked out of the Paris Masters by 18th-ranked Ugo Humbert
summary: Humbert goes on to face Australia's Jordan Thompson for a place in the Paris Masters semi-finals. The French number one just edged Alcaraz in winners on Thursday with 28 to 23 with both men committing 38 unforced errors.

title: In Shanghai, Halloween scares the authorities
summary: Despite a massive police presence, young people dressed up in costumes, some harmless, others very political. Everyone was told to get changed.

title: Dominique Malonga, the first French woman to dunk in a match
summary: The technical gesture, executed by the basketball player on Wednesday, may be commonplace among men, but it is a rarity among women. Among professionals, it was first performed in 2002 by Lisa Leslie who plays for the WNBA's Los Angeles Sparks.

title: A new campus for the University of Chicago in Paris: 'The possibility of studying abroad is an argument in the battle between major American universities.'
summary: The institution of excellence, home to 101 Nobel Prize winners, has invested 30 million euros to provide a new showcase for some 125 of its students, who will be able to study in the French capital every term.

title: US sees rise in executions after years of decline
summary: The number of executions is on the rise in the United States, with the subject of the death penalty little spoken about during campaigning for the November 5 presidential election.

title: Paris Masters: French tennis players in form at last edition before venue change
summary: Five French players, including Ugo Humbert and Arthur Fils, have made it through to the round of 16 of the Paris Masters at the Accor Arena on Thursday before the competition moves to the La Défense Arena next year.

title: Paris Opéra says historic stage to close for two-year renovation
summary: The closure of the almost 150-year-old edifice in mid-2027 will be followed by the closure for the renovation of the opera's giant newer stage, the Opéra Bastille, for at least two years from mid-2030.

title: Paris set to limit traffic in the city's central core
summary: Starting next week, vehicles will be banned from transiting through the area, Paris City Hall announced on Thursday.

title: Morocco detains activist after France spying allegation
summary: Fouad Abdelmoumni, 66, was taken into custody Wednesday on charges of 'reporting a knowingly fictitious crime' and 'spreading numerous false claims.'

title: French PM Barnier 'doing well' after operation for 'cervical lesion'
summary: France's Prime Minister Michel Barnier was back at work after being 'operated on for a cervical lesion' at the weekend, according to his office.

title: 'Four years later, the honeymoon between Biden and the Europeans has hit a few bumps in the road'
summary: While many European leaders were delighted with Donald Trump's defeat in 2020, they also had to come to terms with a certain continuity between the two presidents on foreign policy and the defense of American interests, writes Le Monde's Philippe Ricard.

title: Le Pen's accountants take the stand in far right's fake jobs trial: 'A forgery could become the truth'
summary: The court interrogated the far-right Rassemblement National party's former accountants on Wednesday to find if the party's misappropriation of funds was a rigorously organized system.

title: Super Typhoon Kong-rey strikes Taiwan
summary: One of the biggest storms to hit the island nation in decades, Kong-rey made landfall on Thursday, with 184-kilometer/hour wind speeds, floods and mudslides leading to at least one death and 73 injuries, according to the national fire agency.

title: Trump taunts Democrats with 'garbage' stunt as Harris calls for Americans to 'stop pointing fingers'
summary: Trump climbed into his own branded garbage truck at an airport in Wisconsin, in an election stunt ahead of his rally in Green Bay, as Harris distanced herself from Biden's comments about Trump supporters, instead stressing unity.

title: Harris turns her attention to women's rights after Trump's latest 'offensive' protector language
summary: On Thursday, Harris addressed Trump's comments about how he was going to 'protect' women 'whether they like it or not.' At a rally Wednesday evening near Green Bay, Wisconsin, Trump told his supporters that aides had urged him to stop using the phrase because it was 'inappropriate.'

title: In Felcsut, Hungary, the castle life of Viktor Orban's relatives
summary: This village near Budapest has been pre-empted by the Hungarian prime minister's entourage. His father, son-in-law and childhood friend have become wealthy thanks to contracts financed by the European Union, and own palaces, golf courses and sumptuous villas here.

title: Why the European Commission is opening an investigation into Temu, the Chinese e-commerce platform
summary: Behind the platform's dazzling success, the commercial practices of this online digital bazaar are worrying the European authorities. The import of potentially dangerous products and the addictive nature of the app are being targeted.

title: Ukrainians in Russian-occupied Donbas find ways to escape: 'It wasn't real life, I had to leave'
summary: Ukrainians wishing to leave territories occupied by the Russian army in the east of the country can reach safe zones thanks to the Ukrainian NGO Helping to Leave.

title: A kaleidoscopic portrait of Henri Cartier-Bresson in Landerneau
summary: A retrospective exhibition features the different sides to the master of the 'decisive moment,' with the aim of illustrating his evolution as a photographer.

title: Botswana's president concedes defeat after party loss in election
summary: Mokgweetsi Masisi lost to the left-leaning Umbrella for Democratic Change, led by human rights lawyer Duma Boko.

title: Beyoncé and Harris, Heston and Reagan, Sinatra and JFK: The stars who support US presidential candidates
summary: On October 25, singer Beyoncé came out in support of Kamala Harris at a rally in Houston. Before the Queen of Pop, a number of high-profile stars have tried to swing the race for the White House in their candidate's favor.

title: Devastation in Paiporta, at the epicenter of Spain's floods: 'Dozens of people saved lives all around here'
summary: The city on the southern outskirts of Valencia was devastated by a sudden wave of mud almost 2 meters high, on the night of October 29. At least 62 people perished. Tales of tragedy and acts of courage intertwine in a community in a state of shock.

title: Going down: With the end of 2G in France, elevators and other devices could be affected
summary: The closure of 2G mobile networks from the end of 2025 is likely to put many connected devices out of service, including alarms and remote assistance bracelets.

title: 'Brat' named word of the year by Collins dictionary
summary: 'Brat' was the name of UK singer Charli XCX's hit sixth album, and the word has now come to represent a 'confident, independent and hedonistic attitude,' said Collins.

title: Floods in Spain: 'The Mediterranean's warming is dynamite'
summary: Antonio Aretxabala, a geologist and natural disasters expert, analyzes the reasons behind the high death toll and devastation following the floods that killed almost a hundred people in the Valencia region.

title: North Korea says it will stand by Russia until 'victory' in Ukraine
summary: The North Korean foreign minister was in Moscow as the West believes up to 10,000 North Korean troops are training in Russia and on the brink of entering the war in Ukraine.

title: 'You might expect citizens to favor parties that take global warming seriously. In the US, the opposite is true'
summary: A study shows that personal experience of a climate catastrophe accentuates the partisan divide between Republicans and Democrats over its origin, writes economist Pauline Grosjean in her column.

title: Spain flood death toll climbs to 205 as residents call for aid
summary: The Spanish weather agency issued alerts for strong rains in other regions: Tarragona, Catalonia, as well as part of the Balearic Islands.

title: Flooding in Spain: A controversial trade-off between public safety and economic interests
summary: The disaster in the Valencia region brings back to the forefront a controversy that took place in Madrid in September 2023. At the time, the region's president issued a maximum alert for rainfall that ultimately fell far from the capital. Conservative politicians had criticized her and the meteorological services.

title: In Lebanon, the war plunges vulnerable migrants into terror
summary: Migrants from the Philippines, Sri Lanka, South Sudan and Sierra Leone have been forced to flee their homes in exposed areas or abandoned by their employers. They have few options for finding shelter or leaving Lebanon.

title: Chinese lawyer and his wife sentenced to prison for a meeting with European diplomats
summary: Yu Wensheng, a lawyer and human rights activist, and his wife Xu Yan were sentenced to three years' imprisonment for him and one year and nine months for her for accepting an appointment from the European Union ambassador.

title: Valencia MotoGP canceled due to region's deadly floods
summary: The final race of the season was due to be held on November 17, but will move to another venue, following the catastrophic floods in the area.

title: Macron 'acknowledges' France responsible for 1957 assassination of Algerian nationalist Larbi Ben M'hidi
summary: The young political-military leader of the National Liberation Front was hanged on the night of March 3, 1957, during the Battle of Algiers, by French soldiers who disguised the death of this 'national hero' as a suicide.

title: 'The Diplomat' season 2: The White House comes to the embassy
summary: Allison Janney joins Keri Russell in the cast of the spy series released just days before the US presidential election.

title: Spain's deadly flash floods in images
summary: Videos from Spain show devastated towns and residents in shock.

title: US presidential election: Poor employment figures offer last-minute ammunition
summary: The US economy created just 12,000 jobs in October, with a slump in the private sector linked to the Boeing strike and hurricanes in the southeast. The Trump camp took the opportunity to criticize the record of Biden and Harris.

title: In photos: The waters of the Colorado River, a political issue
summary: From the western United States to northwestern Mexico, American photographer John Trotter has been documenting the consequences of the river's dramatic decline for the past 20 years.
